sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The doubting virgin, and the constant youngman. Observe what here is put in print, all you that do love merriment: it's for young men and maids also, stay and hear't o're before you go. Tune of, The repriev'd captive, by Tobias Brown [sic]. Bowne, Tobias.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner., [London] : [between 1670-1696]
Verse: "Oh my dearest do not slight me ..." Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======

1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner., [London] : [between 1670-1696]
Verse: "Oh my dearest do not slight me ..." Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.

the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.
